page.title: 11FARMING IN 1985
page.content: We are writing about dairy farming near Nantwich in Cheshire, which is the best place for farming in Britain because of our mild winters which mean that the cows stay out longer and not as much winter fodder must be used. In summer it is warm and wet. Grass needs water to grow and the clay retains the water, thus our climate is ideal for growing grass. Cheshire is good for farming as it has fertile soil, and as it used to be a sea it means that the ground is good for using farm machinery. Most of the fields in Cheshire are grass, which is used either for silage (cut grass stored up for Winter) or for the cows to graze on in the summer.
